poem:
"Daybreak In Gal Yosef"

A young shepherd, lost
between grains of ancient sand,
his sheep return alone.
War cries torn from the thorns,
in the light of a fearful dawn
— his absence, 
a hollow wind under the olive trees.

Frantic search, echo of boots,
through fields carved in sorrow,
the boy remains a ghost,
His tale told by footprints,
erased by the ceaseless hands
of time's unforgiving desert.
